Reviews.Title: Terrific Canon T3i bundled package - best deal!
Reviews.Author: calyxxa "calyxxa"
Reviews.Content: I finally pulled the trigger on purchasing my first DSLR camera.  I wanted the Canon T3i plus I wanted both the standard lens and a zoom lens.  I came across this great packaged deal from Cameta Camera.  I was a little hesitant because I was not familiar with this Amazon merchant, but the reviews on this seller were very positive, and this deal was the best I found on the internet.  I wasn't really looking for accessories, but Cameta throws in so many accessories - really, I have everything I need to start...filters, flash, extra battery, memory card, card reader, card holder, camera bag, cleaning kit, screen protectors...I'm sure I'm forgetting something.  Plus, it comes with both the 18-55 IS II Lens and the 55-250 IS zoom lens in addition to the Canon T3i body.  I priced these items on various different websites, including ala carte here on Amazon, and Cameta offered the best deal hands down.  While shipping is expensive ($18) - compared to $0 with Amazon Prime which doesn't apply to this buy, the overall price is still less than other sellers.  I received my shipment in less than a week.  Although I haven't had any problems and haven't needed to reach out to Cameta Camera for customer service, so far, I'm very happy with this purchase and with Cameta.I ensured my camera and lenses thru Square Trade's 3 year warranty, and I've been pretty pleased so far with Square Trade, too.  Very easy to purchase and get registered.Canon EOS Rebel T3i 18.0 MP Digital SLR Camera Body & EF-S 18-55mm IS II Lens with 55-250mm IS Lens + 16GB Card + Battery + Case + (2) Filters + Flash + Cleaning Kit

Reviews.Title: Except Bag everything is very GOOD but no extra flash as displayed in Ad
Reviews.Author: Sri
Reviews.Content: Except Bag everything is very GOOD .No flash (but displayed in the photo)I got this bundle on right date and one day early also .Canon body cam made in japan .canon 18-55 mm lens made in TaiwanCanon 55-250 made in malaysiabelt strap, canon battery ,canon battery charger ,extra 2000 power battery ,remaining accessories mentioned in Photo . i felt happy about the itemsOnly one thing is not comfortable is the bag its very low quality and not comfortable for carrying and shooting .i would recommed to buy this product from cost point of viewbecause outside its (850 (canon body & 18-55 lens kit) + 150 (55-250mm lens) $ ) = 1000$I paid altogethe 1018$ ,which included all other accessories bag ,cleaning items except flash

Reviews.Title: Technical Wonder
Reviews.Author: DMc "dam"
Reviews.Content: I have not used a SLR camera since the 80's. Since then I've stumbled through multiple compact cameras promising great results only to be let down when special conditions arose. So far the T3i has not let me down. The flash that came with the kit is very simple, and except for bounce-flashes, the built-in flash allows more flexibility and is preferred. The other components of the kit are very useful and of good quality. Of course my total expenditure is much greater than that of any compact, but I guess you get what you pay for, and the price is well worth it to me. I might also take the opportunity to push David Busch's guide book on the T3i. It will greatly improve your enjoyment of the T3i and justify the expense. It will even give you insight into using a wireless flash which is why I made a Speedlite my second purchase. With it, anything is possible it seems. I definitely recommend the camera kit as well as the two other items I purchased.

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: sherri
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for an entry level SLR to get back into photography.  Last time I had a decent camera it used 35mm film.  I took some time looking at different brands and decided on the Canon.  Then I spent some time looking at prices and packages.  I am very happy with the camera and two lenses.  The extras in this bundle are ok.  Generic flash, generic extra battery etc...but good to have in a pinch.  I wanted something I could grow with as my skills come back.  So far I've taken some great photos while boating and watching my kids sporting events.  I agree with the other person's feedback on the case.  Nothing special there, however I am using it as a storage case for the items I don't want to carry with me everyday and bought myself a photo backpack to go.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS T3i SLR
Reviews.Author: Merlot Rider
Reviews.Content: I've only had the camera a short time with limited use but I am very happy with this product.  Canon just released the T4i but the differences are not sufficient for me to want to change.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Troy
Reviews.Content: Love everything about it...price quality items.... All is well.... Love the camera.. Great beginners product and this package is full of extra goodies..

Reviews.Title: T3i exceeds my expectations
Reviews.Author: Edward A. Sharp "common sense is rare"
Reviews.Content: Originally bought this for astrophotography, but, with Christmas here, I wanted to get my toy out and see what it could do. It handled indoor action shots of my granddaughter competing on the Wii like no other digital camera I've used. The photo options are many and the camera seems intelligent at taking stable pictures (or not, when there's too much camera movement).More to come when I get this baby outdoors.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: KW
Reviews.Content: I have never owned a DSLR before so I can't make any comparisons but this camera is awesome.  I would highly recommend it to anyone upgrading from a Point & Shoot camera.  My #1 advice is get away from shooting with "auto" and find out what these DSLR's are capable of producing.  16GB SDHC Card, SD card reader, and filters all work great.  I haven't used any of the other extras yet.  The bag doesn't seem to be the best quality but I'm just using it for storing things I'm not needing at the moment (owner's manuals, flash, cleaning kit, etc.).  I bought a Lowepro Slingshot Bag instead (spend a little extra and get a bigger size than what you think you will need).  Overall a great package that will get you a great start on photography.

Reviews.Title: great bundle
Reviews.Author: shiningsun
Reviews.Content: Very great bundle!I'm a new user of EOS camera. I was afraid it would take me a while to handle it. It turned out that it was very self-explainary. And the bundle contains all I need. I think it's a good choice for new users.

Reviews.Title: Everything I wanted and more!  I really was shocked!
Reviews.Author: Isolina T. Marchena
Reviews.Content: I was amazed on how fast I received it and the priced I payed!  The best christmas EVER thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: very much satisfied
Reviews.Author: RP
Reviews.Content: The package had everything as advertised and till now everything is great. It's a good bargin as just the body and the 80mm lens are sold at around 850$ in best buy

Reviews.Title: Awsome Camera,Awsome Bundle
Reviews.Author: D. Mullen
Reviews.Content: I searched for the best deal for this Dslr camera and found this bundled kit from Cameta,It has all the accessories to get you started taking wonderful pictures,The Canon T3I is the most versatile Dslr for the money.It lets you shoot in fully auto like a point and shoot or set up the shot with all aspects being controlled by you making for great creativity. All of the accesories in the kit are just the ticket for taking any type of picture that you need. I just can't express how please I am

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Shelly Budinger
Reviews.Content: Exactly as described, flash included, Image Stabilizer for BOTH lenses.  Make sure when purchasing you use a seller such as this, to receive the image stabilizing lenses.

Reviews.Title: christmas present
Reviews.Author: C. Robert Evans
Reviews.Content: LOoks great.  have not used it since i recevd on Christmas day.  Will know more by the end of january.  Thanks

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T3i 18.0 MP Digital SLR Camera Body & EF-S 18-55mm IS...
Reviews.Author: Sassiebabi "Sassiebabi"
Reviews.Content: Great deal on this package.  This is my first dslr.  Trying to read the manual and learn how to operate it.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Alexsander "Alex"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my camera, and this package was perfect for me. The  55-250 lenses failed on me, however canon fixed the problem. Now what I need is to invest on very nice lenses, those are the expansive parts.I can take amazing pictures with this camera, shoot great videos. Does more than what I need it to do.

Reviews.Title: Great for starters. Some items don't match the description.
Reviews.Author: Marcos Moreira Teixeira
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera for anyone who't starting to learn professional photography.The 18-55 kit lens will give you the basic equipment you need and the 55-250 is a great lens for outdoors, landscape shooting. And the price is really great. There are not so many differences from the T4i and T5i models (only if you really like touchscreen).All of the bundle items came, no exception, but some of them don't match the picture or the ones in the description: the SD card reader, the bag and the flash, i.e.. Although I haven't tested the flash yet and I know that the SD card reader works really well, the bag is just awful. It's made by Zeiko's and not precision design, there's only one compartment for everything and the handle on the top also pulls up all the lid when you carry it so if the lock breaks or loosen up when you're in the middle of the street, your camera will probably hit the ground hard. So be careful with that bag.Other than that, it's really a great purchase. I'm in love with what this camera does. Easy to operate, very sharp pictures.I really recommend it to people who are starting/intermediate. But anyone will soon want to upgrade kit lens.

Reviews.Title: Canon dslr rebel t3i bundle
Reviews.Author: kitkat
Reviews.Content: All met my expectations.  It's been great shooting photos with this camera. All the included accessories allowed me to get going right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera & Lenses, Cheap Extras
Reviews.Author: JaneJaneJane
Reviews.Content: The T3i is great. The lenses are real Canon lenses and seem good. But the extras are pretty much toys. Most of it is useable, but don't expect a lot. The flash is generic and you have a few settings, but it works very well. It's not like the $500+ flash you can get from Canon, but it didn't cost near as much either. The UV filters are great. The extra battery is great. It's a great kit.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Michelle Cross
Reviews.Content: I've been very happy with this camera. I got it because I was I was taking a photography class and I wanted to upgrade my camera and I love taking pictures more now then ever because the pictures are nice, sharp and clear. Would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: easy to use for entry user
Reviews.Author: tata
Reviews.Content: this bundle is a great set, only thing is that i wish the bundle was with the 18-200mm lens instead of 18-55, 50-250.

Reviews.Title: Fast shipping, good price, great product!
Reviews.Author: D. Stanmyer "dstanmyer"
Reviews.Content: This camera came in about a week, or less, and is a true gem.  The basics are easy enough and I'm sure I'll have many months and years of learning advanced features.  Great camera for novice or experienced photographer.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: kvol2000
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera I bought for my daughter who is just now getting into photography. She really loves it as it is easy enough for beginners yet advanced enough for the more experienced.

Reviews.Title: First Impressions
Reviews.Author: gregory b. boyd
Reviews.Content: I bought the T3i camera kit on Oct 9, 2012. It arrived two days before estimated arrival. The kit contained everything advertised.  The Canon products are great. My first Canon was the AE-1, which I got in 1977. I also have a Nikon 35mm camera. This is my first DSLR and I do have a learning curve to conquer. I have kids in sports; my pocket digital just doesn't cut it and my 35mm film cameras are-- well you know the limitations. I will also use the new camera for portrait, still, and outdoor/nature shots. First impressions: "Wow! I look forward to using it. And it's light weight." I am considerably beyond "point and shoot," however, I have a feeling that I may never tap into all the finesse/professional bells and whistles that the T3i offers. WARNING: the Precision Design DSLR300 High Power Auto Flash will NOT work with the T3i's automatic features- it's just a flash. There's not a place to attach the sync cable to the camera that came with the flash. What's even stranger is that the instructions with the flash said that the cable is not necessary for use and never provided instructions on when or why it might be used. I know my AE-1 has a flash cable port, but I've always used the Canon AE flash with the connectors on the hot shoe. I'm not sure I'll use the Precision flash much. This was kind of a disappointment, but Cameta Camera delivered what they advertised and I got what I ordered. Can't complain.  I like the Vivitar UV filters.  Other reviews I read said the carrying case was weak, but it's OK for my needs. I have other bags I can swap if needed.  I think a wireless remote would have been a better addition to the kit than the flash, but we'll see.  Additional purchases: 58mm Rubber Lens Hood for Canon Rebel and Fotodiox Eye Cup Eyecup for Canon EOS Digital Rebel (I'm not sure this was a good idea- it's not an easy swap. But I've spent more time learning the camera than wrestling with the eyecup).  Possible future purchases: the remote, Canon Speedlight Flash, & maybe a polarizer filter.  I will submit another review after a few months and reasonable use.

ProductInfo.Name: Canon EOS Rebel T3i 18.0 MP Digital SLR Camera Body & EF-S 18-55mm IS II Lens with 55-250mm IS Lens + 16GB Card + Battery + Case + (2) Filters + Flash + Cleaning Kit
